result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter Charles Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Peter Charles Hall in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. Victim rights have been complied with. Amend Count 2 to remove "violent" verbiage. Dismiss and read-in Count # 1. Count 2: DEF pleads NC. Found Guilty. Court sentences DEF to 15 days in county jail w/Huber, 1 day credit. Report August 13, 2015  by 3 PM. Fine/costs: $ 579.00 20 days to set up payment plan. Right to appeal.
Off the Record -Defendant Peter Charles Hall in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Peter Charles Hall in court with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties and acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Court enters NOT GUILTY plea to Counts 1 and 2 on behalf of DE.  

Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.

NO CONTACT with Richard Hollen Jr.  

DE must maintain absolute sobriety. 

No abusive Contact with Glenda Barber.
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "    " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagem

APPEARANCES:  John Yackel appeared in person for the State.  DE appeared via video means, in custody.  

Court found probable cause.  Court set $500 signature bond, with conditions:  NO CONTACT with Richard Hollen Jr.  DE must maintain absolute sobriety. 

No abusive Contact with Glenda Barber.
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "    " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
